Operation 'post_/auth' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects, poor_ai_interpretability. The current description is minimal and lacks critical details for AI agent usability. The operation needs a clear summary since none exists. The description should explain: (1) what authentication mechanism is used (credentials-based), (2) what inputs are required (username/password), (3) what is returned (token details), (4) how the token should be used (Authorization header), and (5) any side effects or constraints (token expiration). This enables AI agents to understand when to invoke this operation and how to use the returned token for subsequent authenticated requests.

data.summary_suggestion: Authenticate and obtain an access token
data.description_suggestion: Authenticates a user with provided credentials and returns an authentication token for subsequent API requests. Accepts username and password in the request body. Returns an AuthenticationTokenResponse containing the access token and token metadata. The returned token should be used in the Authorization header for authenticated API calls. Token expiration and refresh policies apply.
data.reasoning: The current description is minimal and lacks critical details for AI agent usability. The operation needs a clear summary since none exists. This enables AI agents to understand when to invoke this operation and how to use the returned token for subsequent authenticated requests.
